events.name: Project Tango!
events.description:
Join us for our very first meetup at OpenGrounds on the Corner! Doug Chestnut from The University of Virginia Library will give an information session and demo of Google's Project Tango.

https://www.google.com/atap/projecttango/

Project Tango is a smartphone and tablet project by Google's Advanced Technology and Projects group (ATAP), formerly a division of Motorola. The "Project Tango" prototype is an Android smartphone-like device which tracks the 3D motion of the device, and creates a 3D model of the environment around it.

We are looking forward to bringing the local Google enthusiast community together and finding out more about where interests lie so we can chart future Meetups. All are welcome!

events.name: Dart - Structured Web Programming
events.description:
Our May 5th event is being hosted at WillowTree Apps!

During our May meetup, we will be getting our hands dirty and running through some codelabs, specifically about the programming language Dart. If you are at the beginner level, no worries. There will be programmers on site to help if you get stuck!

"Dart is a cohesive, scalable platform for building apps that run on the web (where you can use Polymer) or on servers (such as with Google Cloud Platform). Use the Dart language, libraries, and tools to write anything from simple scripts to full-featured apps."

https://www.dartlang.org/

events.name: Hack@Home with Google's own Chet, Dan & Adam
events.description:
Join us at the WillowTree Apps office to hack on ANDROID M with the definitive authorities on the subject!!!﻿

After the meeting we will be entered into a raffle at Google to win some swag!

OFFICIAL SITE FOR THE EVENT:

https://plus.google.com/events/cn2mln1obrhkuhsfin8sobmi0m4?e=-RedirectToSandbox

events.name: Polymer - Web Components
events.description:
After a great overview of Dart by Jeff Ward at WillowTree Apps in May, the topic diverged into Polymer and the future viability of the project. Doug Chestnut has offered to share what he has been learning about web components and show a way-finding kiosk project he has built for the University of Library using Polymer.

"Web Components usher in a new era of web development based on encapsulated and interoperable custom elements that extend HTML itself. Built atop these new standards, Polymer makes it easier and faster to create anything from a button to a complete application across desktop, mobile, and beyond."

Our June meeting will be kicked off right after Google I/O in San Francisco, and it will be interesting to see what is announced!

events.name: Material Design Support Library in Android - Eric Richardson of WillowTree Apps
events.description:
Join us on Tuesday, August 4th 2015 for an informational session by Eric Richardson, Senior Android Software Engineer at WillowTree, Inc.!

 Eric will be going over the Material Design Support Library in Android. We will also be broadening the conversation to what "Material Design" is all about, the design principles it encompasses and also alternative methods to utilizing it.

Our August meeting will be held at WillowTree Apps on the Downtown Mall in Charlottesville. Walk upstairs and follow the signs to our meeting room. Refreshments will be provided!

events.name: Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
Hi everyone! I hope you all are having a wonderful Autumn now that Joaquin & Co. have dissipated and the sun has now returned. :) We have a special guest coming from Washington D.C. to talk to us about Google Cloud Platform .  This event will be held on a Friday at 6 PM. We will have pizza and refreshments so please come hungry!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In this session, Chida Chidambaram gives an overview of Products available to date in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) GCP provides set of scalable Compute, Storage, Networking, Big Data and other Services.

Speaker Bio:

Chida is a known Technology Community Leader in the Washington, DC area, organizing several technology and startup events including Google Developer Group Washington DC. Chida advises on Cloud and Big Data Analytics Strategies for Startups and enterprises. Chida currently serves as CTO of BigData & Analytics at Day1 Solutions.

We hope to see you at WillowTree Apps on October 23rd! 

-Starrie, Doug, and Jossay

events.name: Google Cast SDK - Building Chromecast Apps
events.description:
Happy Holidays Everyone!

Come join GDG Central Virginia for some pre-holiday cheer and learn about developing for Google Chromecast! This is a very cool, useful inexpensive device that is taking off in the consumer market, and the demand for development is growing.

Jossay Jacobo, Android Engineer from WillowTree Apps is going to be talking about some of the new features the Cast SDK supports like Audio, Games and Remote Display. We are also going to go over a sample overall Chromecast implementation; from mobile devices (Senders) to custom backend (Receiver). As well as some edge cases you'd want to take into consideration for building the best user experiences.

Please come join us!

-Starrie, Doug, and Jossay
events.how_to_find_us: Walk up the stairs and follow the signs to the meeting room on the left (next to the upstairs kitchen)

events.name: On the edge of DevTools
events.description:
Hi Everyone! 

I hope this message finds you well and you have been having some fun in the snow. :) We have a very exciting meetup planned for you on February 12th at WillowTree Apps Offices on the Downtown Mall in Charlottesville. You are invited to come warm yourself by the mounted LCD screen filled with code demos and how-tos with your fellow GDG members!

During this meetup you will learn about the latest things coming to Chrome's DevTools by our resident Google Developer Expert, Jonathan Garbee . Also learn how you can contribute to its future development.

We hope to see you on February 12th! As always, yummy refreshments (and probably pizza) will be served by our generous sponsor, WillowTree Apps .

events.name: The Road to Progressive Web Apps - HTTPS
events.description:
Hi Everyone! 

Our group has been on a bit of a hiatus meetup-wise, although we have been working on some exciting upcoming events behind the scenes. Keep a lookout for announcements about some exciting developments for GDG Central Virginia in 2016!

Progressive Web Apps are here. They provide offline capability, improved performance, and an abundance of APIs to give powerful abilities to applications. In order to use these APIs, your application must be secure. Learn why security is important and how to use Let's Encrypt to secure your application for free.

This month we welcome back Jonathan Garbee on Friday April 22, 2016 to lead our group on this topic. Jonathan is a Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies and Chromium Contributor. He works on the official DevTools documentation to assist developers in building their applications rapidly and making sure they hit RAIL metrics.

We look forward to seeing you on April 22nd!

-Starrie, Jossay, and Doug
events.how_to_find_us: Follow the signs upstairs to the conference room!

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2016 Charlottesville
events.description:
This is last minute but you are all invited to come join us in Alderman Library to watch the Google I/0 2016 Keynote LIVE on a large screen amongst other forward thinking developers and designers. :) We will also be live streaming some of the following sessions as they occur. Here is the schedule if you would like to see a taste of what we will stream live.

https://events.google.com/io2016/schedule

 This is our first I/O Extended and will be pretty low key, but we hope you can make it! 

Parking is available in the Newcomb Hall Parking garage and sometimes on the street on University Avenue. 

Room 421 is on the main floor. Walk in the front door and go left. Turn right into the Scholars Lab and Room 421 will be on the right.

See you on Wednesday!

Starrie
events.how_to_find_us: We are going to be meeting in the Scholar's Lab Classroom - Room 421

events.name: Material Design Lite & Building For Others
events.description:
Hi Everyone!

It's been a while, and we have been working behind the scenes to bring some new and interesting events to you throughout the rest of 2016.

Google Developer Expert Jonathan Garbee returns to give a talk about the work he has done contributing to Google's front end styling framework-independent component library: Material Design Lite.

In this talk we will gain insight into the development of Material Design Lite. Spanning from hearing about the initial incubation to the biggest post-launch problems. This talk will provide you with what was learned while building software for other people to develop with.

https://thumbsplus.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/30/posts/24370/preview_image/mdl.png?height=300&width=300

What is Material Design Lite? "An implementation of Material Design components in vanilla CSS, JS, and HTML. Material Design Lite (MDL) lets you add a Material Design look and feel to your static content websites. It doesn't rely on any JavaScript frameworks or libraries."

In other news:

We welcome Jonathan as a new Co-Organizer for our GDG! As both a GDE and GDG Organizer, Jonathan is in a unique position to work within both programs and help improve how they work together while helping us develop our group. 

Also, we are very close to officially announcing our first DevFest in October 2016 here in Charlottesville. More information is forthcoming.

We hope to see you on July 27th at WillowTree Apps!

-Starrie, Jossay, Doug and Jonathan
events.how_to_find_us: Follow the signs upstairs to the big conference room!

events.name: GDG Central Virginia DevFest @ 2016 edUi Conference
events.description:
Greetings and Salutations!

GDG Central Virginia is pleased to announce that we are partnering with edUi Conference to host our very first DevFest within the upcoming 2016 edUi Conference from October 24th-26th. Our DevFest track will be a series of speakers comprising of Google Developer Experts from the mid-Atlantic region, as well as other respected leaders in the Google technology community.

While our DevFest will only take place on the second day of edUi, purchasing a ticket will grant you access to the entire three day conference, including the networking and after event activities. 

What’s a Google Devfest?

GDG DevFests are community-run events powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen. Each GDG DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community that hosts it.

GDG Central Virginia DevFest

Our DevFest will take the form of a series of presentations and a mini-workshop by developers and certified Google Developer Experts. The sessions will all be organized in a single track on Tuesday, Oct. 25th 2016.

Google DevFest Sessions

Stop Wasting Your Analytics Budget

 – Mitch Daniels

Hands on with Google Cloud Platform (Mini Workshop)

 – Sadayappan (Chida) Chidambaram

Develop Maintainable Apps

 – Annyce Davis

Progressive Web Apps with Firebase and Polymer

 – Doug Chestnut & Jill Heinze

Vanilla Custom Element Inter-op: Never Port Your Custom Dropdown Again

 – Danny Blue

What is edUi Conference?

edUi is a conference for web professionals working at institutions of learning—colleges, universities, libraries, and museums.

It provides practical professional development in the fields of user interface and user experience design, with a focus on overcoming the challenges unique to higher education and nonprofit organizations. In-depth, half-day workshops (at no additional charge)Inspirational keynotes from web innovators and top industry peers,  Helpful sessions on the latest trends, hot topics, and best practices that you can put to use right awayLively, fun, extraordinary events that get you out of the traditional “conference bubble” and break up all the professional development and skill-building. Plenty of opportunities to network with fellow higher ed, museum, and library web professionals from across the country who understand the unique challenges of producing websites for large, decentralized organizations.

$200 DISCOUNT FOR GDG CENTRAL VIRGINIA MEMBERS with registration code with code: GDGCVA

Register here!

Keep up to date with the latest information:

www.gdgcentralvirginia.com

www.eduiconf.org
events.how_to_find_us: GDG Central Virginia DevFest will be a track within the 2016 edUI Conference which takes place at LiveArts

events.name: Simplifying Checkout with the Payment Request API / Google TiltBrush Demo
events.description:
Hi Everyone!

We hope everyone had a great holiday break. We definitely did! GDG Central Virginia ended 2016 on an upswing with the resounding success of our very first DevFest conference, which was hosting as it's own track within edUi Conference in Charlottesville, VA. We had over 100 people attend our DevFest sessions, and got some great support from the North American Google Developer Group network!

We are pleased to announce the first of an exciting series of events starting in 2017. These events will be located at The UVA Corner at OpenGrounds during the day time and lunch will be provided! Seats are limited so register early so we know how much to order from the caterer.

Meetup for January 19, 2017:

Google Developer Expert Jonathan Garbee will be back giving a talk about the Payment Request API: "Converting customers doesn't need to be a cumbersome process. The Chrome team has introduced the Payment Request API to help developers by providing a vendor-driven experience. This allows you to get payment information in a seamless way and give customers a consistent experience across sites. Come learn about how to integrate this API to provide your customers with a seamless shopping experience."

After this talk we are going to take a quick walk over to the Claude Moore Health Sciences Library @ UVA to check out Google Tilt Brush (if you have not experienced this yet you have got to try it! This will be a demo that will lead into follow up Meetups about developing with Google Tilt Brush and Google Cardboard.

Stay warm!

Starrie, Anson, Mark and Jossay
events.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back Classroom called "Studio B"

events.name: The Health Science Library is hosting a tech conference, to include Google Tilt
events.description: Sorry for the late notice - the health science library is hosting an event next Wednesday to include Google Tilt Brush, Cardboard, and many other exciting technologies. Come by, enjoy light refreshments, as well as meet with vendors

events.name: Google Virtual Reality Session
events.description:
Hey Folks!

LOCATION UPDATED: 

Claude Moore Health Sci Library
1300 Jefferson Park Avenue, 
Charlottesville, VA 

The Health Sciences Library @ University of Virginia is a little tricky to find if you are not familiar with how to get there, so we are going to meet at OpenGrounds on University Avenue and walk over to the HSL together!

We have access to an HTC Vive that runs Google Tilt Brush.   And we have Cardboard...if you have Cardboard, please bring it so there are more for everyone!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TckqNdrdbgk

Anson Parker, a systems engineer at the UVa Health Science Library, has been working with Google Tilt Brush and Google Cardboard to help him design and build furniture.  Come check out the process of going from one VR realm to another using Blender as an intermediary - it's a lot of fun, and incredibly helpful for doing quick sketches for clients.

Open to some other VR ideas if anyone is interested in pitching them.

Lunch will be provided by Mellow Mushroom!

Rock on,

Starrie, Jossay, Angela, and Anson

events.name: Google I/O 2017 Extended w/ Neon Guild
events.description:
Shout out to all GDG Central Virginia members!

We are proud to announce an upcoming partnership with the longest standing tech community in the Charlottesville area, Neon Guild,  to bring to you an informational and FUN Google I/O Extended! Google I/O 2017 took place in Mountain View, CA from May 17th-19th.  We will be getting together at our gracious host's office - Center for Open Science on June 6th at 6 PM.

Our extended event is sponsored by Google and will be a combination of free food, drinks, quick presentations on the latest technology news from Google, networking and conversation amongst the Neon Guild community!

Part I will be a day earlier at OpenGrounds @UVA at 1:30 PM where we will be streaming some live sessions from Google I/O to the group while consuming goodies and conversing with other group members.

GDG Central Virginia Google I/O Extended will have information on:

• Google Lens

• Google Home

• Tensor Processing Unit (TPU)

• Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence

• Firebase

• Polymer 2.0 Web Components

• Google Cloud

• Accessibility

• Project Tango

• Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality

• Google Photos / Google Photo Books

• Android Developments

AND MORE!

MEETUP.COM link to RSVP:
https://www.meetup.com/Google-Developer-Group-Central-Virginia/events/239636517/

Event on Google Developers

Event on Google+

events.name: Intro to Cloud Machine Learning APIs
events.description:
Hi Everyone! I hope you are all having an exciting summer and staying cool! We are teaming up with yet another Charlottesville tech group, DevOps[CV] to bring a relevant and innovative talk. We are pleased to present the return of the lead organizer of the second largest Google Developer Group in North America (GDG Washington D.C.) and veteran entrepreneur, Chida Sadayappan:

Intro to Cloud Machine Learning APIs

In this session, Chida Sadayappan gives an overview of the emerging Machine Learning concepts and how one can leverage Google Cloud APIs to quickly build applications.

Chida Sadayappan is a Technology Community Leader in the Washington, DC area, organizing several technology and startup events including Google Developer Group Washington DC. Chida currently the  CEO of A.I. and Machine Learning Startup, Blitzar.Io. He successfully exited multiple companies in the past 12+ years of his entrepreneurial career. 

Agenda:

5:30 - 6:00 - Pizza, beer, wine, soda and networking

• 6:00 - 6:15 - Introductions and announcements

• 6:15 - 7:30 - Presentations - Chida is a Google Developer Expert with advanced Machine Learning and Data Warehousing solutions

7:30 - ?:?? - Networking at First Wednesdays

We hope to see you on August 2nd!

--Starrie, Anson, and Angela
events.how_to_find_us: We are on the 3rd floor. Doors enter through the bottom floor. If doors are locked text[masked]

events.name: DevFest DC Fall 2017 (In collaboration with GDG Washington D.C.)
events.description:
Buy your ticket 

Visit devfestdc.org

1 Day, 16 Sessions 

16 technical sessions spanning topics like machine learning, cloud & mobile development, Javascript, and more. Whether you’re an experience developer or a new one, there’s a session for you. 

Hands-on Workshops 

Our CodeLabs go beyond just theory. Get hands-on training on specific technologies, practices, and techniques that you can actually use in your career or on your own projects. 

Firebase Hackathon 

Start the day by learning about Firebase and Cloud Functions. Then put it into practice during our afternoon Hackathon and competition. We’ll have Firebase engineers and experts around to help you turn your idea into an app.

Headliners

SCOTT PENBERTHY, 

Director of Applied AI, Google 

Scott is the Director of Applied AI at Google. In this role, he leads a team of AI engineers and PhDs who help VIPs reimagine the production of goods and services and how value is exchanged in free markets. His team applies current and upcoming AI technologies to materialize proofs of concept and drive long-term transformations. Prior to this role, Scott was a Technical Director in the Office of the CTO, a group at Google dedicated to helping customers thrive in the world of cloud computing. Scott kept one foot in theAI labs of Silicon Valley, the other in Wall Street and board rooms. 

JOSH GORDON

Developer Advocate for TensorFlow, Google 

Josh Gordon is a Developer Advocate at Google working on TensorFlow. He’s interested in teaching and computer science education. He can often be found exploring central park on his bike.

RAY TSANG

Developer Advocate for Google Cloud Platform, Google

Ray is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at RedHat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi Everyone! 

I am writing to invite you to an upcoming technology conference in Northern Virginia on October 9th co-hosted in collaboration by GDG Washington D.C. and GDG Central Virginia. Headliners include Scott Benberthy (Director of Applied AI, Google), Josh Gordon (Developer Advocate for TensorFlow, Google), and Ray Tsang (Developer Advocate for Google Cloud Platform, Google).

If you buy your tickets before September 6th, you qualify for the “Early Bird” discount of $59.99 or enjoy a group discount of 20% off for $47.99 each for 5 or more tickets! Student price is only $25 (Student ID required)! If you are academic faculty or staff at UVA you can use your Education Benefit to pay for tickets. Contact UVA Human Resources for more information.

If you don't make the September 6th deadline, no worries because we have created an exclusive discount code of 25% for Cville Friends! Use the link https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-dc-2017-fall-edition-tickets-36912487243?discount=CVille or enter promotional code CVille 25% during checkout.

Hotel rooms at the Sheraton Tysons Hotel in Northern Virginia will be available for just $99.00. Information for the hotel discount code is still forthcoming. I will also be organizing carpooling so also keep an eye out for that information if you would like to rideshare.

The call of proposals is still open, so if you have a session you would like to lead, fill out this form for consideration!

Thank you. 

- Starrie, Anson and Angela (GDG Central Virginia) 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

events.name: POSTPONED - Open API Framework & Google Cloud
events.description:
THIS MEETUP HAS TO BE POSTPONED DUE TO UNFORESEEN CIRCUMSTANCES

GDG Cental Virginia's Anson Parker is working with the CVille fire department to host a site that utilizes the Open API framework for handling data from one of their surveys. The opendata.charlottesville.org portal is a great example of how to have an api first design. This is looking at the same concept from an open source perspective.

events.name: Drush and Composer (Collab w/ Drupal C-Ville  Meetup - )
events.description:
THIS IS A COLLABORATIVE EVENT WITH DRUPAL CHARLOTTESVILLE MEETUP:

https://www.meetup.com/Charlottesville-Drupal-Meetup/events/253784828/

Drush is an awesome shell interface for managing Drupal right from your cloud server command line. It is a very useful tool as it helps you perform various admin tasks using just one or two commands in the terminal, replacing the need for many clicks and page refreshes in the UI. And, it's FAST!

We will discuss setup, basic commands, where to look for help getting started and of course Q&A. Bring your laptop and experience to share!

Light snacks will be provided. See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Conference Room on the first floor - lower left corner of the building

events.name: Google + Drupal | a social colloboration situation
events.description:
Hi Everyone!

GDG Central Virginia is teaming up with another local tech group (Drupal Charlottesville Meetup) for a social event Wednesday evening at Three Notch'd Brewing Company.

This is our regular monthly first Wednesday social meetup to get together and talk shop, meet new people and bring new topics for discussion to the table.

We are exploring the possibilities of aligning with Drupal developers and this will be a great opportunity to bring new ideas, experience and QA to the table! Let's collaborate - over food and drinks of course!!!

See you there!

events.name: Working with Google Colab to Access and Graph Data
events.description:
Colaboratory is a free Jupyter notebook environment that requires no setup and runs entirely in the cloud. Plotly's Dash is a Python framework for building analytical web applications and is well supported in the colab environment.

On Grounds at UVA, Drupal is the standard for content management - with robust permission schemas and simple GUIs for ingesting, storing, and editing data. Drupal 8 RESTful API generation with views is an off-the-shelf, programming-free solution for passing data along to mining tools such as R and Python.

Walk through the process processing data from UVa sites in to Jupyter notebooks we will ingest the content and perform statistical analysis for graphing with Plotly.

https://colab.research.google.com/notebooks/welcome.ipynb

Colaboratory is a free Jupyter notebook environment that requires no setup and runs entirely in the cloud. Plotly's Dash is a Python framework for building analytical web applications and is well supported in the colab environment.

On Grounds at UVA, Drupal is the standard for content management - with robust permission schemas and simple GUIs for ingesting, storing, and editing data. https://colab.research.google.com/notebooks/welcome.ipynb

events.name: Drupal and Salesforce Integration with Google Tag Manager!
events.description: This will be a session about how to integrate Drupal with Salesforce and Google Tag Manager. Salesforce has been showing increasing use in higher ed as well as other business applications. See how it can powerfully integrate with your Drupal application and Google Tag Manager, too.

group_profile.intro: I am a User Experience Designer and Web Developer who works for the University of Virginia Library. Since I attended Google I/0 in 2012 I have been very passionate about learning all I can about Google developer tools.
